tasks.title: Implement Dynamic Tool Registration System
tasks.description: Replace static toolset filtering with dynamic tool registration/unregistration system that registers tools with flattened names and sends MCP change notifications when toolsets are equipped or unequipped [Updated: 7/14/2025]
tasks.details:
Create a dynamic tool registration system replacing the current getAvailableTools() filtering approach. Implement tool registration with name flattening (git.search â†’ git_search) while preserving exact schemas from underlying servers. When toolsets are equipped: 1) Register tools dynamically with the MCP server using flattened names, 2) Send MCP tool change notifications to connected clients, 3) Maintain mapping between flattened names and original server/tool pairs for routing. When toolsets are unequipped: 1) Unregister tools from the MCP server, 2) Send removal notifications to clients, 3) Clean up routing mappings. Preserve the two-layer architecture specified in PRD with tool discovery remaining separate from dynamic registration. Implement transparent proxying ensuring requests to flattened tool names are correctly routed to underlying servers with original names. Handle edge cases: 1) Name conflicts between servers (use server prefixing as fallback), 2) Tools becoming unavailable while registered, 3) Client connections during registration changes, 4) Partial registration failures. Create ToolRegistrationManager class with methods: registerToolset(toolsetId, tools), unregisterToolset(toolsetId), handleToolCall(flattenedName, params). Integrate with existing ToolsetManager for equipped/unequipped events. Ensure atomic registration operations and rollback on failures.

tasks.title: Fix stdio transport output corruption in MCP protocol
tasks.description: Console output is corrupting MCP protocol messages on stdout when using stdio transport, causing JSON parsing errors in MCP clients like Claude Code
tasks.details:
## Problem
When running hypertool-mcp with stdio transport (default), initialization messages written to stdout corrupt the JSON-RPC protocol stream, causing client connection failures.

## Solution
Redirect all console output to stderr when in stdio mode, keeping stdout clean for protocol messages only.

## Implementation Steps
1. Add STDIO_LOGGING_CONFIG to src/logging/index.ts with console disabled
2. Update src/logging/output.ts to detect stdio mode and redirect Console to stderr
3. Ensure early detection of stdio transport in src/index.ts before any output
4. Handle ora spinners in src/server/enhanced.ts (Phase 2)
5. Add integration test to verify stdout contains only JSON-RPC

## Reference
See detailed PRD: .taskmaster/docs/prd-stdio-fix.md

## Success Criteria
- No non-JSON-RPC data on stdout in stdio mode
- All diagnostic messages available via stderr
- Successfully connects with Claude Code and other MCP clients
